title: Nasdaq Turns Higher. Nvidia Heads for Record.
text: LIVE UPDATES | CONCLUDED Last Updated: March 22, 2024 at 6:04 PM EDT 7 days ago By Connor Smith The Nasdaq Composite turned higher in Friday afternoon trading as Nvidia was poised for its eleventh straight week of gains. The Nasdaq Composite was up 0.2% in recent trading. The S&P 500 was down 0.1%. And the Dow Jones Industrial Average was down 190 points, or 0.5%. The Invesco S&P 500 Equal Weight ETF, which weighs Nvidia the same as any other stock in the S&P 500, was down 0.6%. Nvidia shares were up 3.4%, trailing only FedEx’s 7.1% gain in the S&P 500. The stock is on track to mark its longest weekly win streak on record, according to Dow Jones Market Data. Alphabet shares were also up 2.2%. The top S&P 500 sectors were communication services, technology, and utilities. The big three indexes all marked record closes on Thursday. In the absence of major news, it was a mostly quiet session. The CBOE Volatility Index, or Vix, was down 1.1% to 12.79. “Concerns about the market being stretched are inevitable with such strong gains in the first quarter of the year, with a few analysts' year-end targets already reached,” writes Navellier & Associates founder Louis Navellier. “We're overdue for a correction, if only from rebalancing holdings, where the equity exposure has grown beyond the model weight.” Nasdaq COMP (Nasdaq) S&P 500 SPX (S&P US) DJIA DJIA (Dow Jones Global) NVIDIA Corp.
